title: Question 18
prompt:
Nel and Sula are headed to the river where the boys swim. If a boy she likes comes to talk to Sula, how might she respond?

Sula would likely
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The two friends in this passage are just discovering boys. The passage says that they both became “skittish, frightened and bold.” If a person is skittish and frightened, she may be timid, and if a person is bold, she may be eager. Sula would probably talk with a boy timidly but also eagerly.


“It was in that summer, the summer of their twelfth year, the summer of the beautiful black boys, that they became skittish, frightened and bold—all at the same time.”
